content.rendered:
Whatever you want to do to help keep families together so their children can thrive, we’ve got everything you need to get you started.

If you’re not sure what to do, we’ve also got loads of ideas for you to choose from.

  

Do a challenge event

Challenge yourself and others by taking part in one of our exciting challenges or set your own challenge to help keep families together.

Pledge a special occasion

Celebrate and pledge your special occasion so children can celebrate theirs.

Organise an event at your work

Bring colleagues together to help keep families together.

Organise an event with your friends

Bring colleagues together to help keep families together.

Sell stuff online

What could be a better incentive to declutter than to know you are helping to keep vulnerable families together at the same time?

What our fundraisers say:

"I wanted to support Hope and Homes for Children because they’re an organisation that focuses on love and family. I played Super Mario World deathless on Twitch with my friends and asked for donations and raised nearly £200!" 

"I turned 48 during lockdown and realised how grateful I was to be with my family. It made me think how much worse it was for children in orphanages so I decided to pledge my birthday to raise money for Hope and Homes for Children. I raised over £500, so I'm already planning to do the same for the big 5-0 when I'll hopefully have a party too!"

excerpt.rendered: Want to fundraise but lacking ideas? We’ve got you covered. Browse here for inspiration and ideas.
